application_instruction: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Sunnyvale, CA, USA; Seattle, WA, USA; Austin, TX, USA
description:
Google Cloud teams work with schools, companies, and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile and collaborative. You will oversee all aspects of the Google Cloud sales process, improving it with your insightful data analysis, troubleshooting, and seamless cross-functional teamwork. Your strategies ensure that companies new to Google products get the highest quality customer support and that the Google Cloud program overall is kept on the cutting edge.

A certification is like a mini-product in that there is a detailed behind-the-scenes process to researching, developing, launching, and maintaining the exam, to ensure a high quality product our customers will value.

As a Certification Exam Program Manager, you will be responsible for developing, launching, and maintaining certification exams. This will include research, job task analyses, running content creation workshops, reviewing all exam questions, measuring success, ensuring a quality end-product, and collaborating with the other teams to increase adoption of the certification. You'll be working with technical Google subject matter experts (SMEs) to create the exam questions and performance-based scenarios.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • 5 years of experience in program management.
  • Experience facilitating working groups (e.g., job task analyses, item writing and development workshops, question writing training, item reviews, and standard setting sessions).

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in the certification industry.
  • Knowledge of the cloud technology space.
  • Understanding of statistics and related concepts (e.g., bell curves, normal distributions, etc.).
  • Ability to learn about the certification industry, including ISO 17024.
  • Ability to learn Google Cloud products and technologies.
responsibilities:
• Meet with subject matter experts (SMEs) to write and validate technical exam questions and content.
  • Maintain a project plan detailing every detail of exam development, launch, and maintenance.
  • Collaborate with other functions of the certification team to operationalize the exam.
title: Certification Exam Content Manager, Google Cloud, Google Cloud
